docs.lead_paragraph: Gov. Paul LePage's administration is facing a potential loss of federal funding to administer its food stamp program over concerns about the state's decision to put photos on cards used to access the benefits.

headline.main: Maine Risks Losing Funding Over Food Stamp Policy
headline.print_headline: Maine Risks Losing Funding Over Food Stamp Policy

docs.snippet: Gov. Paul LePage's administration is facing a potential loss of federal funding to administer its food stamp program over concerns about the state's decision to put photos on cards used to access the benefits.

docs.lead_paragraph: Taking a cholesterol-lowering drug for five years in middle age can lower heart and death risks for decades afterward, and the benefits seem to grow over time, a landmark study finds. Doctors say it's the first evidence that early use of a statin can have a legacy effect, perhaps changing someone's odds of disease for good.

headline.main: Early Statin Use May Give Long-Term Heart Benefits
headline.print_headline: Early Statin Use May Give Long-Term Heart Benefits

docs.snippet: Taking a cholesterol-lowering drug for five years in middle age can lower heart and death risks for decades afterward, and the benefits seem to grow over time, a landmark study finds. Doctors say it's the first evidence that early use of a statin can...

docs.abstract: Wednesday: single-digit wind chills, a new marijuana policy takes effect, and Al Sharpton’s tax issues.
docs.snippet: Wednesday: single-digit wind chills, a new marijuana policy takes effect, and Al Sharpton’s tax issues.

docs.lead_paragraph: Researchers are optimistic about recent efforts to delay the effects of aging and, perhaps, extend life spans.

headline.main: Science (and Quacks) vs. the Aging Process
headline.print_headline: Science (and Quacks) vs. the Aging Process

docs.abstract: Scientific community is optimistic about efforts to improve longevity, but warns against spending money on products that offer fantastic claims; researchers say, while they are not able to stop or reverse aging, they can slow rate at which people get old and keep people healthier longer.
docs.snippet: Researchers are optimistic about recent efforts to delay the effects of aging and, perhaps, extend life spans.

docs.lead_paragraph: A growing consensus in favor of Truvada is opposed by one vocal man, Michael Weinstein, and his nonprofit organization.

headline.main: AIDS Group Wages Lonely Fight Against Pill to Prevent H.I.V.
headline.print_headline: Drug to Lower H.I.V. Risk Has Lone Public Naysayer

docs.abstract: The Upshot; Michael Weinstein, president of Los Angeles-based nonprofit AIDS Healthcare Foundation, speaks out against use of Truvada to prevent HIV with national ad campaign; warns widespread use of drug erodes condom use and leaves many open to infection; Weinstein also notes that research found many people were not consistently taking Truvada and therefore risking HIV infection.
docs.snippet: A growing consensus in favor of Truvada is opposed by one vocal man, Michael Weinstein, and his nonprofit organization.

docs.lead_paragraph: A steadily rising number of parents face a wrenching choice about whether to add antipsychotic drugs like Risperdal to stimulants like Adderall to treat children for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.

headline.main: One Drug or 2? Parents See Risk but Also Hope
headline.print_headline: One Drug or 2? Parents See Risk but Also Hope

docs.abstract: Steadily rising number of American families face dilemma of whether to let children take multiple psychotropic drugs to temper their troublesome behavior; many experts worry that use of multiple psychotropics in youngsters has not been explored fully; there is also debate over whether database that lists patients' adverse drug reactions reliably monitors risks of psychotropic drug combinations.
docs.snippet: A steadily rising number of parents face a wrenching choice about whether to add antipsychotic drugs like Risperdal to stimulants like Adderall to treat children for attention deficit hyperactivity disorder.

docs.lead_paragraph: Officials in Chhattisgarh State issued an urgent warning to practitioners to cease distribution of the antibiotic ciprofloxacin after at least 15 deaths were linked to contaminated pills.

headline.main: Indian State Recalls Pills Linked to Sterilization Deaths
headline.print_headline: Indian State Recalls Pills Linked to Sterilization Deaths

docs.abstract: Senior official in Indian state of Chhattisgarh says antibioitic pills contaminated with rat poison may have been cause of at least 15 deaths of women following sterilization surgery; police arrest officials at Mahawar Pharma, small company supplying medicines to state government.
docs.snippet: Officials in Chhattisgarh State issued an urgent warning to practitioners to cease distribution of the antibiotic ciprofloxacin after at least 15 deaths were linked to contaminated pills.

byline.contributor: Gardiner Harris contributed reporting from Bokaghat, India.
